tts.input: The text to generate audio for. The maximum length is 4096 characters.
tts.voice: alloy, echo, fable, onyx, nova, and shimmer

stt.file: The audio file object (not file name) to transcribe, in one of these formats: flac, mp3, mp4, mpeg, mpga, m4a, ogg, wav, or webm.
stt.language: The language of the input audio. Supplying the input language in ISO-639-1 format will improve accuracy and latency.
stt.prompt: An optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio segment. The prompt should match the audio language.
stt.response_format: json, text, srt, verbose_json, or vtt
stt.timestamp_granularities[]: The timestamp granularities to populate for this transcription. response_format must be set verbose_json to use timestamp granularities. Either or both of these options are supported: word, or segment. Note: There is no additional latency for segment timestamps, but generating word timestamps incurs additional latency.
